page.title: 17Legionnaires Disease Scare
page.content:
The killer disease Legionnaires Disease was thought to have affected Redcar.
The scare went up on July 10th 1985 when a report in the local newspaper said that organisms of the disease had been traced in the water systems of four buildings in the county.
It was later revealed that The Gables, an old people's home in Redcar with 43 residents, was one of these buildings.
With 39 people dying from the disease in Staffordshire it was quite a scare. The County Council Leader said that the scare was over as the bug was dead and the buildings were given the "all clear".
